dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This dataset should be bibliographically referred to as the “GISCO Ports 2013dataset”. It contains one point feature classes with the location of 2440pan-European ports, plus one attribute table and 3 domain tables. The ports are identified following the UN Locode list. The dataset is based on the list “Ports Estat 2010” from Eurostat. Point coordinates and Locodes are derived from several input sources, including ports lists from EMSA, Lloyds, Norie’s Seaports of the World, the GISCO Ports 2010dataset and the UN/LOCODE 2007 list. Attributes in PORT_AT_2013include the port name, Locode Status Indicator, and reliability flags for the positional and Locode accuracy. Dataset coverage is global. ---------- Extensions of PORT_2010 and upgrade of locationbased on list ofnew ports and those to be removed provided by Eurostat unit B4. This clasification was created based on the statistical information about the ports. They have been classificated based on the annual number of passangers and the handling tonnage.

The New records added in PORT_AT_2010are provided from EUROSTAT. 73 new ports added, 38 ports removed
dataIdInfo.idPurp:
The dataset has been created for cartographic purposes and for appropriate analysis. Port statistics can be geo-referenced to this high quality pan-European dataset, especially when based on UN Locode.
-------- Extensions of PORT_2009 and upgrade of location

thesaName.resTitle: Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 14 March 2007 establishing an Infrastructure for Spatial Information in the European Community (INSPIRE)

Consts.useLimit: The datasets have been created for cartographic purposes. Not to be used for navigation.

LegConsts.othConsts: Source should be acknowledged: "Source: GISCO - Eurostat (European Commission)"

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.5.4400

distorCont.rpPosName: Responsible of reference geodatabase for the EC

dataLineage.statement:
Port names and Locodes were mainly taken from the Eurostat list "Ports Estat 2010", or the UN/LOCODE 2007 list. This dataset is an update of the 2009 dataset with additional ports added and some removed. No polygon data hsa been supllied with this version
Point location sources were, in decreasing order of preference: 1. European Maritime Safety Agency (EMSA) list of ports by calls 2. Lloyds MIU list of European ports 3. GISCO Ports 2009 dataset (PORT_2009). This was derived from some of the same sources used for this dataset, plus Norie’s Seaports of the World list (in Norie’s Nautical Tables, Imray, 2007) 4. UN/LOCODE 2007 list (UNECE, 2007) 5. List of additions and removals supplied by Unit B4 in Eurostat
Many of the processing steps included some manual matching, editing or checking steps to improve data quality. Reference sources used included port organisation websites, online port lists, and aerial imagery. The busiest 60 ports according to the "EU Energy and Transport in Figures: Statistical Pocketbook 2009" were visually checked against input and reference sources. Effort was also focussed on Eurostat statistical ports. All matching steps included manual checks of join tables or the spatial data to help overcome naming or conceptual differences between sources. Some expected errors were manually fixed.
LOCD_STTS_CODE port attributes derived from UN/LOCODE 2007, and LOCD_STTS_DOM table copied from the StatusIndicator table of the UN database. PORT_COOR_RELI_CODE positional reliability attributes were calculated for port points based on the process for reaching the final point coordinate. PORT_LOCD_RELI_CODE attributes were derived depending on the port’s proximity to settlement features that verify the port name (and hence Locode). TEN_CODE and PROC_TEN_CODE attributes provided by GISCO. STAT_PORT_CODE and REMK are Eurostat attributes from the "Ports Estat 2010" list. Extensions of PORT_2010 and upgrade of location The New records added in PORT_AT_2010are provided from EUROSTAT. 73 new ports added, 38 ports removed

prcStep.description:
Create Working Ports Polygon dataset with Names Assigned: Ports polygons created from CLC2000 + ERM HarbourA. Names allocated from STTL_RG_250K_V3 by intersect or 200m buffer and intersect. Visual checks where port overlays several settlements. Preparation of point data sources, such as conversion of lists with coordinate attributes into point datasets.
Allocate LOCODEs to Named Port Polygons: Removal of ERM geometry where polygons from both sources. Dissolve to create multipart PORT_RG. Match named RG to PT datasets within 1 arc minute based on location and name coincidence (fuzzy matching with Levenshtein algorithm). Automated selection steps, in order of source confidence, then visual matching. Join remaining unmatched RG to UN list by name to allocate LOCODEs where possible.
Allocate LOCODEs to Unnamed Port Polygons: Match unnamed PL to PT with 1 arc minute based on location. Automated steps in order of source confidence, but not where disagreement between point sources. Visual matching step.
Create First instance of PORT_2009 Dataset: Manual correction of known errors. Creation of single PORT_RG dataset with unique Locodes. First PORT_PT dataset created from source points that had been matched to RG. Points outside the RG or the land moved to Near point 10m inside the inland port polygon relative to CNTR_RG_100K_2006. Where no source PT feature, new PT created inside RG at or near centroid. Port name attributes filled from input sources in priority order.
Add Port Points with no Polygon: Unused port points selected from GISCO_PT_2008 and EMSA where the Locode is not already used in the working ports dataset. Some new points also created for ports added to the Estat list since 2008 but not yet represented. Matching unused port points to STTL_V3, again based on proximity (within 1 arc minute) and fuzzy name matches. PT matched to but outside STTL_RG were moved just inside RG. PT matched to STTL_PT (but not to STTL_RG) were moved to the settlement location. Any new offshore PORT_PT were moved inland relative to CNTR_RG_100K_2006
Complete Attribution, Tables and Checking: Deletion of some points with incorrect Locode. Check PORT_PT don’t overlay unused port polygons. Attributes completed and domain tables created. Visual checks of busiest EU ports. Check against Estat lists of deleted ports. Checks of polygons overlapping several points, to ensure the polygon was linked to the point for the most important port.
----- Extensions of PORT_2009 and upgrade Have been added the new worldwide ports provided by EUROSTAT; Join the clasification port list with PORT_AT_2009 with the UN/LOCODE to populated the new field PORT_HIER_CODE; Corrected the Attributes and some LOCODEs

dataSource.srcDesc: Eurostat “Ports Estat 2009” list; CLC2000 vector dataset; ERM v3.0 HarbourA dataset; GISCO STTL_V3 dataset (from ERM v3.0); UN/LOCODE 2007 list; GISCO Ports 2008 dataset; EMSA list of ports by calls; Lloyds MIU list of European ports; Norie’s Seaports of the World list; internet reference sources ------ Extensions of PORT_2009 and upgrade of location. GISCO Ports 2009 dataset; Reference_ports_EXTRA_EU.xls by EUROSTAT; 2009-2 UNLOCODE CodeList.mdb by UNECERussian ports.xls by EUROSTAT; World Port Index (WPI.shp) by NGA_National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency; World Ports(world_ports.shp) by Hofstra University; RWDB2 Ports and Harbours (RWDB_Port.shp) by FAO ; ICEDS (http://iceds.ge.ucl.ac.uk/) (Integrated CEOS European Data Server) WMS; ESRI_Imagery_World_2D (WEB SERVICES) by ESRI;

DQConcConsis.measDesc: All feature classes and attribute tables should be present

ConResult.conExpl: All feature classes and attribute tables are present

DQDomConsis.measDesc: The integrity and cardinality of the relationships (conceptual and implemented) were checked by enforcing primary and foreign key integrity constraints in Oracle. The constraints referencing domain tables were a test of domain consistency.
DQDomConsis.evalMethDesc: Errors during creation of integrity constraints.

ConResult.conExpl: No errors occurred, so the integrity of all primary and foreign keys was confirmed. All coded values are compliant to the relevant domains (except for any NULL values). The cardinality can only be confirmed where it is strict enough for this test to detect errors.

DQConcConsis.measDesc: CNTR_CODE must be coincident to the first two character of PORT_ID except for GB, GF, GP, MQ, RE, XC and XL.

ConResult.conExpl: Only the valid exceptions were returned by the query, so otherwise the dataset conforms to this rule
No errors were found, so port regions do not overlap

DQTopConsis.measName: Consistency between Port points and regions
DQTopConsis.measDesc: Every Port region must cover a Port point with the same PORT_ID

ConResult.conExpl: No errors were found, so all Port regions contain a Port point with the same PORT_ID

DQTopConsis.measName: Consistency between Port points and Country regions
DQTopConsis.measDesc: Every Port point must be properly inside a polygon in CNTR_RG_100K_2006 with the same country code.

ConResult.conExpl: No errors were found so all Port points are located inside a CNTR_2006 Country region with the same code

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Primary key. Locode port identification code.
Country code (ISO-3166-1). Conceptual foreign key to CNTR_AT.
Name of the feature in national language.
Name of the feature in national language with ASCII characters.
Name of the feature in national language for HTML display.

descript.abstract: REQUIRED: A brief narrative summary of the data set.
descript.purpose: REQUIRED: A summary of the intentions with which the data set was developed.

citeinfo.origin: REQUIRED: The name of an organization or individual that developed the data set.
citeinfo.pubdate: REQUIRED: The date when the data set is published or otherwise made available for release.
citeinfo.title: PORT_AT_2009

timeperd.current: REQUIRED: The basis on which the time period of content information is determined.

sngdate.caldate: REQUIRED: The year (and optionally month, or month and day) for which the data set corresponds to the ground.

status.progress: REQUIRED: The state of the data set.
status.update: REQUIRED: The frequency with which changes and additions are made to the data set after the initial data set is completed.

bounding.westbc: REQUIRED: Western-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in longitude.
bounding.eastbc: REQUIRED: Eastern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in longitude.
bounding.northbc: REQUIRED: Northern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in latitude.
bounding.southbc: REQUIRED: Southern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in latitude.

theme.themekt: REQUIRED: Reference to a formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of theme keywords.
theme.themekey: REQUIRED: Common-use word or phrase used to describe the subject of the data set.

idinfo.useconst: REQUIRED: Restrictions and legal prerequisites for using the data set after access is granted.
